item.title: EPA Seeks Nominations for Environmental Champions
item.description: (New York, NY – December 13, 2016) Each year, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency recognizes and honors environmental trailblazers – individuals, businesses and organizations that have contributed significantly to improving the environment and protecting public health.
item.dc:creator: Region 02

item.title: EPA Takes Action to Protect Benner Bay and Mangrove Lagoon in St. Thomas, U.S.V.I. from Water Pollution
item.description: (New York, N.Y. – November 3, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has ordered the owner of the Mariendahl Quarry Complex and related industrial areas in Estate Mariendahl, St. Thomas, to address its discharges of stormwater and wastewater.
item.dc:creator: Region 02

item.title: EPA Honors U.S. Virgin Islands Environmental Champions
item.description: (New York, N.Y. – May 13, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency today honored two organizations from the U.S. Virgin Islands with Environmental Champion Awards for their achievements in protecting public health and the environment. EPA Regional Administrator Judith A.
item.dc:creator: Region 02

item.title: EPA Provides the U.S. Virgin Islands $8 Million for Water Infrastructure Projects
item.description:

item.title: EPA anuncia $7 millones en fondos para reducir emisiones de diesel de los autobuses escolares
